CatDescriptText: Mrs. Helen Dzickonski, secretary, Roosevelt Acres and Miss Leonora Hunt, elevator operator, Francis Street, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 8, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think that women should wear Bermuda or walking shorts, or similar apparel, while walking along the streets?" Helen Dzickonski's answer reads: "Not along the city streets, but it's all right around small towns, resorts or on the beaches."  Miss Leonora Hunt's answer reads: "No, I do not.  I don't think that it's proper.  I feel that they are best worn in the home, but not in town."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Helen Dzickonski wearing plaid blouse, standing in front of stone block building with tile mosaic pattern; Portrait of Leonora Hunt wearing sleeveless patterned shirt, standing opposite stone block building with tile mosaic pattern
